intro: Psychotria arborea, commonly known as the sacred tree or the tree of the dead, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a red, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds. Psychotria arborea is often associated with spiritual and ritualistic practices in indigenous cultures due to its psychoactive properties.
